title: 111_hr3844
content: Special depreciation allowance and recovery period for noncommercial aircraft property. Special depreciation allowance for noncommercial aircraft property is amended to include an additional 50% depreciation deduction for qualified noncommercial aircraft placed in service. The special depreciation allowance for noncommercial aircraft property includes a 50% depreciation deduction for qualified noncommercial aircraft placed in service. This deduction is reduced before computing the depreciation deduction for taxable years 2010 or 2011. The special depreciation allowance for noncommercial aircraft property includes a 50% depreciation deduction for qualified noncommercial aircraft placed in service after December 31, 2009, and before January 1, 2012. Qualified noncommercial aircraft acquired after the enactment of this subsection and before January 1, 2015, are treated as 3-year property. The special depreciation allowance for noncommercial aircraft property includes a 50% depreciation deduction for qualified noncommercial aircraft placed in service after December 31, 2009, and before January 1, 2012. Qualified noncommercial aircraft acquired after the enactment of this subsection and before January 1, 2015, are treated as 3-year property. The term 'qualified noncommercial aircraft property' refers to aircraft not used in transporting persons or property, to which this section applies. The term 'qualified noncommercial aircraft property' excludes property under subsection (k)(1) and alternative depreciation property. The term 'qualified noncommercial aircraft property' excludes property to which the alternative depreciation system applies, without considering certain election options, and after applying section 280F(b) for listed property with limited business use. If a taxpayer elects out for any property class in a taxable year, this subsection does not apply to all property. Special rule for self-constructed property: If a taxpayer manufactures, constructs, or produces property for their own use within specific timeframes, certain requirements will be considered met. The amendments made by this section allow for a deduction in computing minimum tax for qualified noncommercial aircraft property placed in service after the enactment date of the Act.
